metadata.title: CVE-2018-1000076 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - low
metadata.description:
RubyGems version Ruby 2.2 series: 2.2.9 and earlier, Ruby 2.3 series: 2.3.6and earlier, Ruby 2.4 series: 2.4.3 and earlier, Ruby 2.5 series: 2.5.0 andearlier, prior to trunk revision 62422 contains a Improper Verification ofCryptographic Signature vulnerability in package.rb that can result in amis-signed gem could be installed, as the tarball would contain multiplegem signatures.. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 2.7.6.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1000076` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

jruby - 9.1.17.0-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jruby package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1.17.0-3').
